title: Três Rios
text:
Três Rios (, ) is a municipality located in the <a href="States%20of%20Brazil">Brazilian state</a> of <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro%20%28state%29">Rio de Janeiro</a>. As of 2020 its population was an estimated 82,142 inhabitants, and its area is around . The current <a href="Mayors%20in%20Brazil">mayor</a> of Três Rios is Joacir Barbaglio Pereira (known as Joa) of the <a href="Liberal%20Party%20%28Brazil%2C%202006%29">Liberal Party</a>, elected in <a href="2020%20Brazilian%20municipal%20elections">2020</a> to a four-year term.
The name Três Rios, meaning "three rivers" in Portuguese, is a reference to the three important rivers in the area: the <a href="Para%C3%ADba%20do%20Sul">Paraíba do Sul</a>, the <a href="Piabanha%20River">Piabanha</a>, and the <a href="Paraibuna%20River%20%28Minas%20Gerais%29">Paraibuna</a>. The city itself is located on the Paraíba, and the three rivers meet downstream, to the east. The name "Esquina do Brasil" () was inspired by the words of former president <a href="Juscelino%20Kubitschek">Juscelino Kubitschek</a>, referring to the major highways that pass through. Três Rios 
Três Rios hosts a campus of the <a href="Federal%20Rural%20University%20of%20Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Federal Rural University of Rio de Janeiro</a> (UFRRJ), called the "Instituto Três Rios", which offers four undergraduate programs.
Sports.
There are three sport clubs in the city. "<a href="Am%C3%A9rica%20Futebol%20Clube%20%28TR%29">América</a>", "<a href="Entrerriense%20Futebol%20Clube">Entrerriense</a>" and "Três Rios Futebol Clube". América's <a href="association%20football">football</a> section is currently closed, but the club still disputes <a href="basketball">basketball</a> competitions. Entrerriense and Três Rios FC's football sections are currently active. Três Rios is currently disputing <a href="Campeonato%20Carioca%20%28lower%20levels%29">Campeonato Carioca Third Level</a>.
